item.description:
Meek's Cutoff directed by Kelly Reichardt   USA 2010 104 min.

Meek's Cutoff starts at 4:30 pm

Meek's Cutoff opened today at Kendall and with the success of Reichardt's previous film, Wendy and Lucy  there should be no concern that Meek's Cutoff will not continue its run at Kendall through the month of May. I'd like to point out that there is also a new "super-bar" that just opened in the Kendall area this month called Meadhall that offers 100 or so beers on tap. Hopefully this will become the new "hip place" to go to around Kendall and Tommy Doyle's and the Cambridge  Brewing Co. will provide somewhat quieter settings for our group discussions. Here's hoping Meadhall is a brilliant success!!! 

Anyway, onto the film: The year is 1845, the earliest days of the Oregon Trail, and a wagon train of three families has hired mountain man Stephen Meek to guide them over the Cascade Mountains. Claiming to know a shortcut, Meek leads the group on an unmarked path across the high plain desert, only to become lost in the dry rock and sage. Over the coming days, the emigrants face the scourges of hunger, thirst and their own lack of faith in one another's instincts for survival. When a Native American wanderer crosses their path, the emigrants are torn between their trust in a guide who has proven himself unreliable and a man who has always been seen as a natural born enemy. Metacritic description

Told largely in long shot, it's a painfully, beautifully slow film, which is understandable given the time, place, and situation. Ty Burr Boston Globe

Reichardt trusts her audience, encourages her viewers to feel comfortable in the stillness and the quiet, and to draw their own conclusions from an ending that's as profound as it is enigmatic. A lyrical poem for some, like watching paint dry for others. I'd argue for embracing the poetic, a rare commodity in American films these days. LA Times

After the film we will have our group discussion at Doyle's or CBC-hope to see you there,

Tom
item.how_to_find_us: Tom will be holding a meetup sign near the front row after the film. We will go to a nearby eatery after for our group discussion.
item.name: Meek's Cutoff
